title: Thunder fall to Grizzlies
text:
Posted: 10:40 a.m. Saturday, Oct. 17, 2015 Thunder fall to Grizzlies View Larger Memphis Grizzlies forward Jeff Green, from left, Oklahoma City Thunder center Steven Adams, Grizzlies guard Lazeric Jones, and Thunder guard Andre Roberson scramble for a loose ball in the second half of an NBA basketball preseason game Friday, Oct. 16, 2015, in Memphis, Tenn. (AP Photo/Brandon Dill) Sponsored Links MEMPHIS, Tenn. â€” 
(AP) - JaMychal Green scored 18 points, Ryan Hollins added 16 and the Memphis Grizzlies beat the Oklahoma City Thunder 94-78 Friday night in a preseason game missing stars for both teams. 
Russ Smith and Jeff Green added 15 points each for Memphis, which remained undefeated in four preseason games. 
Anthony Morrow led the Thunder with 16 points, and Steven Adams finished with 15. 
Thunder rookie Cameron Payne, the 14th overall pick in this year's draft who played high school ball in Memphis, scored 11 points in 23 minutes. Sign up for our FOX23 News This Morning Newsletter Sign Up
